meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with tiny mitises, each one chirping happily.
meanings.sent2: The researcher studied the mitises in their natural habitat to understand their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The mitises decided to throw a party in the flower bed, inviting all their insect friends.
meanings.sent4: The mitises in the tree sang together, creating a beautiful symphony of nature.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the mitises glowed softly, adding a magical touch to the garden.

meanings.definition: Mitises: third person singular present of mitis
meanings.sent1: She mitises every morning, greeting the day with a smile.
meanings.sent2: The bird mitises from branch to branch, searching for the perfect nesting spot.
meanings.sent3: The cat watches as the mouse mitises around the room, unaware of the danger.
meanings.sent4: His words mitises through the crowd, reaching the ears of all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The river mitises gently, carrying leaves downstream in a peaceful dance.
